meanings.definition: To waste or squander time or money frivolously.
meanings.sent1: She frittered away her allowance on unnecessary things.
meanings.sent2: He always fritters his time on video games instead of studying.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel frittered its nuts by burying them in random places.
meanings.sent4: The careless shopper frittered her savings on items she didn't need.
meanings.sent5: The student frittered his chances of success by skipping classes.

meanings.definition: To break or tear into small pieces.
meanings.sent1: The toddler frittered the paper into tiny shreds.
meanings.sent2: She fritters the bread before feeding it to the birds.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat frittered the yarn into a tangled mess.
meanings.sent4: The storm frittered the leaves off the trees, scattering them everywhere.
meanings.sent5: He frittered the clay into small chunks for his pottery project.

meanings.definition: To fry or cook small pieces of food.
meanings.sent1: Mom fritters the vegetables in hot oil for a crispy snack.
meanings.sent2: The chef fritters the shrimp to serve as an appetizer.
meanings.sent3: The fair offered delicious apple fritters at the food stand.
meanings.sent4: She learned to fritter the bananas to make a tasty dessert.
meanings.sent5: The street vendor fritters the dough into golden brown treats.
